result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Curtis Alexander Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Curtis Alexander Evans.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Court set a plea/sentencing date upon request from the defense.  State notified of date via email.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Curtis Alexander Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney John J Forrestal appeared by video for Curtis Alexander Evans.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtis Alexander Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney John j Forrestal appeared by video for Curtis Alexander Evans.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case may be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br.40.

Defendant Curtis Alexander Evans in court with Attorney John j Forrestal. Defendant Curtis Alexander Evans in custody.   Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello .  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
